title.native: 舞妓さんちのまかないさん
title.english: Kiyo in Kyoto: From the Maiko House

description:
Kiyo and Sumire came to Kyoto from Aomori Prefecture, dreaming of becoming maiko. But after an unexpected turn of events, Kiyo starts working as the live-in cook at the Maiko House. Their story unfolds in Kagai, the Geiko and maiko district in Kyoto, alongside their housemate maikos. Kiyo nourishes them daily with her homecooked meals, and Sumire strives toward her promising future as the once-in-a-century maiko.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

Note: Each episode was released on the fourth Thursday of each month. One episode usually features three chapters.
synonyms: The caterer at the Maiko Manor

title.native: 舞妓さんちのまかないさん

node.description: Once the assistant of [Makoto Raiku](https://anilist.co/staff/97657) and [Saijyo Shinji](https://anilist.co/staff/98156/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YooheySuzuki) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鈴木洋平_(アニメ演出家))

Youhei Suzuki is a director and former director of photography formerly working for [J.C.Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/JC-Staff). Currently freelance.

Not to be confused with the producer of the same name Youhei Suzuki (鈴木洋平).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nyorock1)

Originating from [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/).

Affiliated with [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/松倉友二)

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/) since 1992, where he currently serves as the Executive Officer and General Manager of Production Headquarters. Also the representative director of Jam Creation.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).
